page.title: 05 Royal Air Force Mildenhall
page.content: The airfield at Mildenhall was first established in 1931 and had three grass runways. In 1934,the Royal Air Force arrived and it was in that year that the airfield was used for the start of the England to Australia Air Race. In 1935, King George V came for the first full review of the R.A.F. and in 1936 the first {Air Show} was seen by 6,000 visitors.In 1985,over 300000 attended. During the 1939-45 War, many raids were made from the Station and it was attacked several times by enemy aircraft. In 1950,the United States Air Force arrived at R.A.F.Mildenhall and they have remained here ever since. The airfield has become a vital part of NATO and is also known as The Gateway to the United Kingdom as all U.S.Forces and their dependents arrive at the {Passenger and Freight Terminal.}
